item.title: Destiny 2: Xur Exotic Armor, Weapon, and Recommendations for September 13
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Xur brings new legendary and exotic gear, including Hawkmoon, for Destiny 2 players at a permanent residence in The Tower Bazaar area.
  • Exotic weapons include Sweet Business, Sunshot, Two-Tailed Fox, and a new Hawkmoon roll.
  • For exotic armor this week, Xur has Wormhusk Crown for Hunters, Stormdancer's Brace for Warlocks, and Mk. 44 Stand Asides for Titans.

Xur has returned again to Destiny 2 , complete with new exotic and legendary gear for players to check out for a limited time. With the arrival of the weekly reset, Destiny 2 is celebrating its 10 year anniversary with a small in-game event. During the celebrations, players can earn a special new set of armor, and its ornaments, based on designs from the original game. A new Title and Triumphs are also available to chase, allowing players to unlock the Legend title.

Alongside the anniversary event news, Bungie also revealed its plans for next year when Codename: Frontiers launches in Destiny 2 over the summer. While Bungie is still working on a lot of the content and designs, players now know that Codename Frontiers includes 2 medium-sized expansions (think Shadowkeep rather than The Final Shape), 4 free major updates, along with 4 reward passes to go along with them. In addition, Bungie is planning to overhaul various parts of the game, including the Director, in an attempt to make the game more approachable and easier to find certain content quicker.

In the meantime, it's time to talk about the weekend merchant Xur, who has brought a brand-new inventory of exotics and legendary gear for Destiny 2 players. Follow this guide for his current weekend location, news on his exotic cipher quest, as well as a review of all the exotic and legendary gear he's brought for the weekend of September 13, 2024.

Where is Xur?

Xur has now taken up permanent residence in the Bazaar area inside The Tower, so there's no more hunting when the weekend comes around.

Since the Bazaar is located between both fast travel points, players can pick either one to load into. Head into the area where Ikora and Hawthorne are and look for the Ramen Shop towards the back wall. While facing the shop, the alley is to the right, where Xur is standing.

Destiny 2 Class Armor and Exotic Cipher

Xur's role continues to offer the usual weekly quests, exotics, and legendary gear. Not only are these quests required to purchase a second fated engram, but they're necessary to acquire legacy exotic gear from the Tower kiosk. Players can earn a new cipher by completing strikes and winning crucible or gambit matches. Gain bonus points for playing with clan mates or finishing more challenging activities.

Xur's Exotic Armor

Stormdancer's Brace - Warlock chest armor

Exotic Perk :

  • Ascending Amplitude - Each target you defeat with Stormtrance increases the damage you deal with it and refunds Super energy when Stormtrance ends

Once again, Warlocks get the lowest rolled exotic. As such, this is a hard item to recommend, even though it's a solid PvE item used to increase the damage of Stormtrance and refund energy.

Stat Values (61 Total):

  • Mobility +6
  • Resilience +10
  • Recovery +16
  • Discipline +16
  • Intellect +11
  • Strength +2

Wormhusk Crown - Hunter helmet

Exotic Perk :

  • Burning Souls - Dodging gives a small health and shield bump.

Wormhusk remains a popular choice for many Hunters thanks to its ability to keep players alive. However, this one may be a tough sell as the roll on it is a bit lower than many would like and probably won't be replacing any versions currently unlocked. Still, for those who don't yet have it at all, it's worth a pickup regardless.

Stat Values (63 Total):

  • Mobility +15
  • Resilience +9
  • Recovery +8
  • Discipline +10
  • Intellect +10
  • Strength +11

Mk. 44 Stand Asides - Titan leg armor

Exotic Perk :

  • Seriously, Watch Out - Grants an overshield when you're sprinting at full health with Seismic Strike, Hammer Strike, or Shield Bash equipped and charged. Hits with these abilities recharge a portion of your melee energy.

Once again, the highest total roll belongs to Titans this week. Unfortunately, the roll is stuck on an exotic that is okay and certainly not a must-have compared to some of the other options readily available. In addition, the mobility stat is unbelievably high this week, making this one an easy pass.

Stat Values (66 total):

  • Mobility +26
  • Resilience +3
  • Recovery +6
  • Discipline +19
  • Intellect +10
  • Strength +2

Xur Inventory Items

Year 7 in Destiny 2 has upgraded Xur's inventory, adding a true rank progression system, rewards, as well as focusing options. Xur also has more than just weapons and armor as well, including:

  • Wardcliff Coil Catalyst
  • Bad Juju Catalyst
  • Stoicism/Solipsism/Essentialism Exotic Class Items OR Exotic Cipher
  • Exotic Engram
  • Enhancement Prism
  • Glimmer
  • Nightfall Cipher (Adept)
  • Enhancement Core
  • Strange Gift (Random Item for 1 Strange Coin)

Xur's Exotic Weapons

Year 7's Xur revamp has also added the ability to offer multiple exotic weapons in one visit. Here is what Xur has this weekend:

Hawkmoon - Hand Cannon

  • Paracausal Shot - Final blows and precision hits with Hawkmoon grant stacks of Paracausal Charge. The final round in the magazine deals bonus damage based on the number of stacks. Stowing Hawkmoon on the final round removes this bonus.
  • Extended Barrel
  • Alloy Magazine
  • Moving Target
  • Smooth Grip

Sweet Business - Auto Rifle

  • Payday - Larger magazine. Increased accuracy when firing from the hip. Picking up Special or Heavy ammo immediately reloads this weapon.
  • Business Time - Sustained fire boosts range and rate of fire.
  • Polygonal Rifling
  • Armor-Piercing Rounds
  • Composite Stock

Sunshot - Hand Cannon

  • Sunburn - This weapon fires explosive rounds and highlights targets that take damage from Sunshot.
  • Sun Blast - Targets defeated with Sunshot explode in Solar energy, scorching other nearby targets.
  • Chambered Compensator
  • Accurized Rounds
  • Textured Grip

Two-Tailed Fox - Rocket Launcher

  • Twintails - Shoots two rockets, one Void and one Solar, that can track onto the same target.
  • Play with Your Prey - The Void rocket suppresses enemies. The Solar rocket causes damage over time.
  • Confined Launch
  • High-Velocity Rounds
  • Composite Stock

Xur's Destiny 2 Legendary Armor Set and Weapons

Xur's Set of Legendary Armor and Weapons. All gear costs 50 Legendary Shards and 1000 Glimmer.

  • Friction Fire (Kinetic Submachine Gun)
  • The Deicide (Energy Shotgun)
  • Death Adder (Energy Submachine Gun)
  • Stochastic Variable (Energy Submachine Gun)
  • Hoosegow (Heavy Rocket Laucher)
  • Blast Battue (Heavy Rocket Laucher)
  • Crown-Splitter/Quickfang/Eternity's Edge (Heavy Sword)
  • Strange Weapon Engram
  • Simulator Armor Set

item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley Players Discover Surprise Feature
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Disney Dreamlight Valley players discovered they can decorate the New Orleans gazebo with furniture and items.
  • Many players were unaware of this feature, leading to surprise and excitement in the community.
  • The Dapper Delights Star Path offers a premium pass with exclusive items, including the popular New Orleans gazebo.

Some observant Disney Dreamlight Valley players recently discovered an unknown feature that allows them to place furniture and items inside one of the game's newest additions, the New Orleans gazebo. The item was introduced in the most recent premium pass in Disney Dreamlight Valley as a decorative outdoor item, but the game seemingly never indicates that players can place things inside it.

Disney Dreamlight Valley is full of unique features and items for players to customize their own village and populate it with their favorite characters from across various Disney properties, ranging from the latest Pixar films to all-time classics. To unlock many of these items, though, players often have to craft them or complete tasks to unlock them with premium currency.

As such, players continue to discover new things in the game, such as Reddit user Many_Reflection5531, who shared an image of their Dreamlight Valley character standing under the new gazebo with a couple of benches. The player had reportedly just discovered that they could place furniture underneath the roof of the gazebo, giving them another unique spot for them to decorate their village.

Player Discovers Hidden Mechanic With New Gazebo Item

The feature has seemingly gone undiscovered by many others, as quite a few fans commented on the post saying that they had no idea it existed and that they planned on trying it themselves. Currently, it's unclear whether other gazeboes in the game can also be decorated similarly, seeing as the original player only used the New Orleans gazebo from the current Dapper Delights Star Path in Dreamlight Valley to do so.

Other players seemingly did the same, as some mentioned the item was the main reason they purchased the premium pass for the current season of Dreamlight Valley, which unlocks exclusive items, including the new gazebo. The premium pass is an exclusive tier of the Star Path in Dreamlight Valley , which works similarly to the battle pass in Fortnite , seeing players complete tasks to level it up and unlock new items.

The newest Star Path in the game added various things from the popular Disney film The Princess and the Frog, bringing the fan favorite Princess Tiana and various bayou-themed items to Dreamlight Valley for players who purchase it. While gazeboes have appeared in the game before, the brand-new New Orleans gazebo has become one of the new Star Path's most popular items after the discovery that it can be decorated, opening up brand-new avenues for customization.

item.title: The Sims 4: How to Find the Hospital
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where Is the Hospital in The Sims 4
  • How to Access the Hospital in The Sims 4
  • How to Edit the Hospital in Sims 4
  • How to Treat a Sick Sim in The Sims 4

The Sims 4 is a life simulation game, so there are several aspects of day-to-day life that players will find replicated in the game. Just like in the real world, there is a hospital in The Sims 4 but it's not accessible to everyone.

This guide dives deep into The Sims 4 hospital, and it provides useful information including how it works and who can access it. On top of this, it also shows players how they can cure their Sims if they ever have the misfortune of becoming sick.

Where Is the Hospital in The Sims 4

In The Sims 4 , players can access the hospital by purchasing and installing the Get to Work expansion pack. Unfortunately, The Sims 4 hospital is inaccessible through the world map . The only way to go to the hospital in The Sims 4 is to have a Sim join the Doctor Career or have a pregnant Sim go into labor .

How to Access the Hospital in The Sims 4

Being able to visit the hospital in The Sims 4 is only useful if players want to edit it, as it's not actually possible to get an appointment, cure an illness, or go for a check-up. Gamers who want to build a new hospital will have to simulate one of these situations so they can access the building and edit it:

Doctor Career

One of the ways to access the hospital is to choose the Doctor career in The Sims 4 . Since this is an active career, each workday gamers will get to choose if they'd like to join their Sim at the hospital until they finish their shift. During this time, gamers will get to take over their Sim's life in the hospital.

Pregnancy

When a pregnant Sim goes into labor, they can have the baby at home if the player continues to let them endure the contractions at their house. However, players can also select the Sim and choose the option "Have Baby at the Hospital". After this, the game will prompt the player to send their Sim alone or join them.

How to Edit the Hospital in Sims 4

If players simply want to edit the building to create their own save file or improve how it looks, they can do so by editing it in Build Mode. Once players have gotten one of their Sims into the hospital, players will have to active cheats, since it's not possible to edit the hospital while the Sim is working or in labour.

Here is how to edit the hospital in The Sims 4 :

  • Open the cheat console by pressing “Ctrl+ Shift + C” on Windows and all four bumper buttons on consoles
  • Enable cheats by typing “testingcheats on” or "testingcheats true" in the cheat console and pressing enter
  • Type “bb.enablefreebuild” in the cheat console to gain access to Build Mode at any time

How to Treat a Sick Sim in The Sims 4

If a Sim has become ill, then gamers will have to treat them so that they can quickly recuperate and go about their days without the Uncomfortable moodlet bringing them down. Unfortunately, Sims can't visit the hospital if they've come down with something, so they'll have to resort to at-home remedies. Here are the various ways to treat an illness in The Sims 4 :

Drink Orange Juice

To drink orange juice in The Sims 4 , gamers have to interact with a refrigerator or any other container that allows them to grab cold Quick Meals, such as a cooler. Then, they have to choose Have a Quick Meal or Drink option and then select Orange Juice .

Drink Tea

An alternative to orange juice is tea, which players can brew if they purchase the Tea Magic Personal Brewer in Build Mode for 275 Simoleons.

Sleep

There's no better way to cure a Sim's illness than staying in bed and letting them nap or sleep whenever possible.

Take Medicine

To get Medicine in The Sims 4 , players have to select the "Order" option on any computer, then "Purchase Medicine", and lastly make an order with the desired number of medicine bottles.

The Medicine will be immediately added to the Sim's inventory, and they can drink it simply by interacting with it and selecting the "Take Medicine" option.

item.title: How Age of Mythology: Retold's Norse Gods Compare to the MCU's
item.description:
The rather extensive pantheon of Norse gods and goddesses has received countless different portrayals in the world of entertainment over the last few centuries. Of course, some of the most memorable and widely recognized depictions of Norse gods come from their more recent portrayals, such as those in games like God of War and movie franchises like the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Now, Age of Mythology: Retold has just thrown its hat in the ring.

One of the four pantheons in the remake, Age of Mythology: Retold allows players to embody three Major Gods of the Norse pantheon, each one equipped with a unique set of traits and special abilities that encourage distinct playstyles and strategies. Along with these three Major Gods, Age of Mythology: Retold brings nine Minor Gods to the table as well. Naturally, there's quite a bit of crossover between Age of Mythology: Retold 's Norse pantheon and the one found in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

The Similarities and Differences Between Age of Mythology: Retold and the MCU's Norse Gods

Comparing The Visual Design of Age of Mythology: Retold and The MCU's Norse Gods

Coming just four movies into the Marvel Cinematic Universe, 2011's Thor thrust a handful of Norse gods, goddesses, and heroes into the mainstream spotlight. While the titular god of thunder took center stage, his half-brother Loki and father Odin were main players as well. As the MCU continued, more and more Norse characters started to pop up, with Thor Ragnarok introducing Hela as a primary antagonist.

Generally speaking, there are quite a few similarities between Age of Mythology: Retold 's Norse gods and the ones that appear in the MCU, especially when it comes to visual design. It's clear that both Age of Mythology and the MCU took inspiration from traditional depictions of the Norse gods, with Loki wearing his horned helmet in both iterations, and both versions of Odin being dripped out in the finest silver and gold armor.

But a key difference between the visual design of Age of Mythology: Retold and the MCU's Norse gods is that the latter's are a bit brighter and more colorful to better fit with their comic inspirations. Thor, for instance, wears a similar set of armor in both depictions, but the MCU's version features a bright red cape, and in later iterations, often has colored highlights on his chestpiece. Loki's MCU design follows a similar trend, embracing the character's penchant for green, while his Age of Mythology counterpart wears a simple, dark fur tunic.

Comparing The Powers of Age of Mythology: Retold and The MCU's Norse Gods

In Age of Mythology: Retold , each Major God and Minor God grants the player a special ability known simply as a God Power. While Thor and Odin's God Powers don't bear any strong similarities with their MCU counterparts, Loki's does seem like an ability the MCU iteration would have.

Simply named "Spy," Loki's God Power lets players see the line of sight of any enemy unit they select. Unlike the other God Powers in Age of Mythology: Retold , Loki's Spy ability isn't announced to the other players in the game upon activation. This ability feels in line with the MCU's Loki, with the villain-turned-hero often using illusory magic to gain the upper hand.

item.title: Fortnite: How to Get The Cyclone Pink Painted Style
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Get the Cyclone Pink Painted Style in Rocket League
  • How to Get the Cyclone Pink Painted Style in Fortnite

Fortnite offers a wide range of cosmetic rewards that players can acquire, typically by purchasing items through the in-game store with V-Bucks. However, other cosmetics, like the free Katalina skin, can often be obtained through other means, and this also extends to Fortnite's vehicle skins.

Though not as common as Fortnite's roster of epic character skins, a few vehicle cosmetics can be acquired for free or at a low cost. One example is the Diestro Gold Trim, a neat collaboration between Fortnite and Rocket League: Sideswipe . Continuing the Rocket League crossovers, players can also unlock the Cyclone Pink Painted Style in Fortnite through a specific method inside of Rocket League .

How to Get the Cyclone Pink Painted Style in Rocket League

The Cyclone Pink Painted Style can be obtained by purchasing the Season 16 Rookie Pack for Rocket League , which will cost $1.99.

The Season 16 Rookie Pack can be purchased through either Rocket League's in-game store, the Epic Games Store, or via players' platform store.

It's worth noting that if players purchase through the Epic Games Store, they will be able to use their Epic Rewards towards their purchase . This means that some players may be able to get the Season 16 Rookie Pack for free if they have enough Epic Rewards saved.

How to Get the Cyclone Pink Painted Style in Fortnite

Once purchased, the Cyclone Pink Painted Style will automatically be available in Fortnite , provided both games are linked to the same Epic Games account. However, the Season 16 Rookie Pack will only be available for a limited time, so players should act fast if they want to grab it. On top of receiving the Cyclone Pink Painted Style, players will also receive the Friction Trail (only usable in Fortnite Rocket Racing) and six additional Decors if they do not already own the Cyclone.

Owning the Cyclone Pink Painted Style grants players access to the Cyclone Car Body as well, which can be equipped as a Sports Car skin via the locker for both Battle Royale and Rocket Racing.

Players who only own the Pink Painted Style will be unable to change it unless they have purchased the Cyclone Bundle , which has appeared in the Fortnite Item Shop on numerous occasions for 1,500 V-Bucks.

The color of the Car Body, however, can be customized as players see fit. Additional Cyclone Bundles often appear in the Item Shop as well, including the Nick Eh 30 Cyclone Bundle and the Adidas Copa Cyclone Bundle, both of which cost an additional 1,500 V-Bucks and offer extra Decors for the Cyclone.
